content.question: Which of the following best represents a signaling pathway that will lead to multiple responses from the same signaling molecule?

choices.label: The answer choice is a figure in which different shapes represent the components of a signaling pathway. The figure shows a cell membrane with an embedded structure that looks like a circle from which one pie-shaped wedge is missing. The missing wedge is on the face of the circle that is outside the cell. Two different shapes are shown outside the cell, and a portion of each shape is complementary in shape to the missing wedge of the circle. An arrow points from each shape to the missing wedge of the circle. Inside the cell, an arrow points from the embedded circle to a large dot, and another arrow points from the dot to a small square.

The answer choice is a figure in which different shapes represent the components of a signaling pathway. The figure shows a cell membrane with an embedded structure that looks like a circle from which one pie-shaped wedge is missing. The missing wedge is on the face of the circle that is outside the cell. A single wedge that is complementary in shape to the missing wedge of the circle is shown outside the cell, close to the missing wedge of the circle. Inside the cell, two arrows point from the embedded circle, one to a large dot, and the other to a small square. Arrows then point from both the large dot and the small square to a single rectangle.

The answer choice is a figure in which different shapes represent the components of a signaling pathway. The figure shows a cell membrane with an embedded structure that looks like a circle from which one pie-shaped wedge is missing. The missing wedge is on the face of the circle that is outside the cell. A single wedge that is complementary in shape to the missing wedge of the circle is shown outside the cell, close to the missing wedge of the circle. Inside the cell, an arrow points from the embedded circle to a large dot. Two arrows then point from the large dot, one to an oblong shape and the other to a small square.

The answer choice is a figure in which different shapes represent the components of a signaling pathway. The figure shows a cell membrane with two identical embedded structures that look like circles, each missing one pie-shaped wedge. The missing wedge is on the face of the circles that is outside the cell. Two different shapes are shown outside the cell, each close to one of the embedded circles, and a portion of each shape is complementary in shape to the missing wedge of the circle. Inside the cell, an arrow points from one of the embedded circles to a single large dot, and then another arrow points from the dot to an oval. Inside the cell, an arrow also points from the other embedded circle to a single rectangle, and then another arrow points from the rectangle to a square.

content.answer: The answer choice is a figure in which different shapes represent the components of a signaling pathway. The figure shows a cell membrane with an embedded structure that looks like a circle from which one pie-shaped wedge is missing. The missing wedge is on the face of the circle that is outside the cell. A single wedge that is complementary in shape to the missing wedge of the circle is shown outside the cell, close to the missing wedge of the circle. Inside the cell, an arrow points from the embedded circle to a large dot. Two arrows then point from the large dot, one to an oblong shape and the other to a small square.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
